meanings.definition: To tilt or lean at an angle.
meanings.sent1: She canted her head to the side to get a better view.
meanings.sent2: The tower canted slightly in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The cat canted its body in a funny way while trying to catch the toy.
meanings.sent4: The old tree canted towards the sunlight, reaching for its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The bookshelf canted dangerously, threatening to spill its contents.

meanings.definition: To have an oblique or slanted direction.
meanings.sent1: The road canted sharply to the left, leading us into the forest.
meanings.sent2: Her handwriting canted slightly upwards on the page.
meanings.sent3: The river canted lazily, making it hard for the boat to stay on course.
meanings.sent4: The shadows canted across the room as the sun began to set.
meanings.sent5: The roof canted downwards, causing rainwater to collect in one corner.

meanings.definition: To give a biased or distorted account.
meanings.sent1: The reporter canted the story to favor one side over the other.
meanings.sent2: His retelling of the events canted the truth to suit his own agenda.
meanings.sent3: The comedian canted the joke, making it even funnier than before.
meanings.sent4: Her memories canted with time, becoming more exaggerated with each retelling.
meanings.sent5: The painting canted reality, showing a world unlike our own.
